female_data = data[data.gender=='female']
male_data = data[data.gender=='male']

fig, axs = plt.subplots(4,2,figsize=(15,30))

sns.kdeplot(data=male_data, x='avg_score',hue='race/ethnicity',fill=True,ax=axs[0,0])
sns.kdeplot(data=female_data, x='avg_score',hue='race/ethnicity',fill=True,ax=axs[0,1])
#axs[0,0].set_xlabel("hello")
sns.kdeplot(data=male_data, x='avg_score',hue='lunch',fill=True,ax=axs[1,0])
sns.kdeplot(data=female_data, x='avg_score',hue='lunch',fill=True,ax=axs[1,1])

sns.kdeplot(data=male_data, x='avg_score',hue='parental level of education',fill=True,ax=axs[2,0])
sns.kdeplot(data=female_data, x='avg_score',hue='parental level of education',fill=True,ax=axs[2,1])

sns.kdeplot(data=male_data, x='avg_score',hue='parental level of education',fill=True,ax=axs[2,0])
sns.kdeplot(data=female_data, x='avg_score',hue='parental level of education',fill=True,ax=axs[2,1])

sns.kdeplot(data=male_data, x='avg_score',hue='test preparation course',fill=True,ax=axs[3,0])
sns.kdeplot(data=female_data, x='avg_score',hue='test preparation course',fill=True,ax=axs[3,1])

Visualize distribution:
Now we will visualize avg_score distribution to make some conclusion. There are many tools to visulalize distribution. The most common tools are as follows:-
1) Histogram
2) Cummulative Distribution
3) Kernel Distribution Function (KDE)
4) Q-Q plot (to check if data is normally distributed or not)

source.b3fd9bd5:
Introduction

In this notebook we will try to find interesting Inferences from Students Performance data. This notebook will be little different from normal EDA because here we will make statistical inferences based on plots and data distribution.
Let us first understand what is Inferential Statistics
Decuction:-It is a conclusion which we reach based on widely accepted fact. For example:- A sandwich is made of two breads one over other.
Inference:-It is a conclusion which we reach on the basis of some evidence or observation. For example:- We see at lunch 4 out of 6 employees order sandwich, by this we infer that sandwich of that place is good.
Inferential Statistics :- In this we take data from sample and make generalization or conclusion about population based on Observing sample.
So here we are going to make various plots see distribution of each categories and make inference about average score.
source.c6f12c5f:
We see their is no effect of parent's education in case of female child, But there is effect on male child. Here we see in the first plot that parent's whoose education is of associate's degree or master's degree their male child tend to perform well in exam. But for female there is no such trend.

Inference no 5:- Parents whoose education is of associate's degree or master's degree their male child tend to perform well in exam.

We will now see effect of race/ethnicity on avg_score.
